title: Average Rates of Change - Piecewise Function

content.question: Consider the piecewise function <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="W open parentheses t close parentheses equals 125 minus 0.2 t squared for 0 less than or equal to t less than 20, or W open parentheses t close parentheses equals 445 minus 20 t for 20 less than or equal to t less than or equal to 22"><mi>W</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="" open="{"><mtable columnalign="left" columnspacing="1.4ex"><mtr><mtd><mn>125</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0.2</mn><msup><mi>t</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mo> </mo><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo><</mo><mn>20</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>445</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>t</mi></mtd><mtd><mtext>for</mtext><mo> </mo><mn>20</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>22</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. Which of the following is a correct statement about the average rates of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> ?

choices.label: The average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="0 less or equal than t less or equal than 5"><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>5</mn></math> is less than the average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="5 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

The average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="10 less or equal than t less or equal than 15"><mn>10</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></math> is less than the average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="5 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

The average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="15 less or equal than t less or equal than 20"><mn>15</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>20</mn></math> is greater than the average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="10 less or equal than t less or equal than 15"><mn>10</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></math>.

The average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="21 less or equal than t less or equal than 22"><mn>21</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>22</mn></math> is less than the average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="20 less or equal than t less or equal than 21"><mn>20</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>21</mn></math>.

content.answer: The average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="10 less or equal than t less or equal than 15"><mn>10</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>15</mn></math> is less than the average rate of change of <math alttext="W"><mi>W</mi></math> for <math alttext="5 less or equal than t less or equal than 10"><mn>5</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>10</mn></math>.

topic.text: 1.3: Rates of Change in Linear and Quadratic Functions

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Describe the characteristics of a function with varying levels of precision, depending on the function representation and available mathematical tools.
